Research

A Turing-Complete Subsitution Model of Computation

Programming

React :

react-speedreader ReactJS, CSS modules

I decided to prop-drill the state and dispatch, creating a proto-version of a reducer before I read/knew about them. The theming system is flexible, and can handle lots of themes fast - just modify the CSS and add one line of 3 words to the Javascript code. Let CSS do what it does best.

Fullstack projects (MERN stack)

travel and shop

These projects were assigned for class. We worked in a team of 3, with me doing most of the programming. A messy codebase. The only noteworthy thing is the extensive component reuse of <Filterable> and <Filterbar> in Travel. These components make it easy to add new filters as possible, or remove old ones. Just add a useState hook, pass it to an object. This way work on the frontend minimised, and backend work is completely zero. Once you add a filter on the frontend, backend handles it automatically - no changes needed.
